list: This semi-gloss sheen is a lustrous, durable finish that is perfect for areas that require frequent cleaning and superior resistance to moisture; ideal for entryway doors, garage doors and accent trim
Exterior paint for property management and residential repaint
Resists fading for longer lasting color
Easy spray, roller or brush application makes fast work of every job

specs.title: For Use on Porches and Floors
For Use on Barn and Fence

reviews.title: "Look no further... but get it tinted."
reviews.text: This is the best exterior paint I have ever come across.  The coverage is amazing and it adds such depth and character to your project (mine is a fence).  I first painted the fence white with Barn and Fence paint because my choices were either red or white.  The white fence was IMPOSSIBLE to maintain so I went on a search.  I found treasure in this paint and always have it on hand. (We have a little "garden structure" affection.  You can see in the first photo when I went from white to Stormcoat.  The fence took on a whole different feel.  Everyone loves it.  Don't waste your money on expensive designer paint.  This is what you are looking for. We spend just about every Friday night at Lowes with our doggie, dreaming and planning.  Don't stop doing what you do. Enjoy.
reviews.author: SuzieFireworks

reviews.title: "Love our new look!"
reviews.text: We purchased 20 gallons of gypsy teal and 10 gallons of white. We have a large house and are not quite done with the trim yet. If the weather would just cooperate I think a few more days will do it. We also purchased a graco airless sprayer. The teal covered in one coat and looks great, the white however is taking 3 coats, but bear in mind we are covering dark brown. As for the 15 year warranty , only time will tell! The X5 Graco is wonderful! Would give it 5 stars all day long! I have a photo to add, but the color doesn't photograph true to color!
reviews.author: CJ25

reviews.title: "Just as described"
reviews.text: I have an old & ugly garage built of concrete block. The block is very pitted  and has some small cracks. I wanted to clean it up and the guy at Loees recommended this paint. I was thrilled to see how nice and thick it was. Edging was so easy because it didnt run or drip much from the brush. It was able to roll a nice, thick coat, easily covering rust marks & my patching. Three months in the sun & looks great! See pics.
reviews.author: Dewey

reviews.title: "Last a long, long time"
reviews.text: Man has been battling the elements for hundreds of years, and paint manufactures have been busy improving paints. I have been a contractor for over 30 years and I think the best paint on the market is Valspar. I have a customer that I painted their house over 20 years ago and I just finished pressure washing that house. With just a few touch ups the paint will last another year! You can pay more for other paints, but I doubt you will find a paint better than Valspar. This year I will pass my 3000 gallon mark, and I've never had a customer complain!
reviews.author: Bob-the-builder

reviews.title: "Fantastic- Best Ever"
reviews.text: I purchased this to paint a window in a backdoor. I had barely finished painting when it began to rain, I thought OH my what a waste of time and money. I went inside and after the rain I was thinking I would have to wash it off and repaint, to my surprise: the paint dried rather quickly, and there were no damages by the rain, UNBELIEVABLE. My thanks go out to Valspar. I'm sold for exterior paint this will be my choice from now on. It has rained intermittently for a week and the paint has withheld great.
reviews.author: LLW1222

reviews.title: "Exactly what I needed"
reviews.text: I am painting a house to try and sell it after renting it for several years. To be polite the renters haven't been kind to it and neither has the weather here in New England. All I needed was an inexpensive paint that would cover completely and dry quickly and this did the trick. One of my renters had painted the house, which was built in 1991, in lieu of some rent a few years back. When I started in on a detailed inspection I found several areas of trim that he had missed. Therefore sections weren't painted in 22 years! One coat did the trick and it looks great. I used the same type of paint tinted for the rest of the house and it is the best looking property on the street now according to the realtor.Highly recommend this product!
reviews.author: IRengineer

reviews.title: "Looks great"
reviews.text: Painted  carport and patio   Had not been paying it in 10 years    Just cleaned and painted no primer look great
reviews.author: Mickey

reviews.title: "Finally a rite-priced high-quality paint!"
reviews.text: First time user of StormCoat and I am very pleased. I paint for part of my living and therefore have an opportunity to try many varieties of paints. This will be a favorite for me and first choice for use on my personal house. I used it to paint the board behind my new gutters and will use it on other parts of my house as well. The price is less than $20 a gallon (no more $40 paint for me!) and the quality is extremely good. Time will tell the full story. I am impressed with the thickness of the paint. Another plus is that it can be applied when temperatures get down to the high 30's.
reviews.author: Chappy

reviews.title: "Thick paint"
reviews.text: A lot of paints I've seen lately are pretty runny. Seems like water has been added to the paint to get the volume needed for the can. Not this stuff. I dip the brush, don't skim it on the side, and wait for it to drip. It takes a long time for it to drip if it does. I like this stuff. It goes on thick. So sometimes it is a one coat paint. I can't give it 5 stars yet, since I don't know yet how it will do in the long run. But I will be paying attention.
reviews.author: Vcap

reviews.title: "Fast Drying Advantage"
reviews.text: This product is thick and has lots of body. The whiteness seems to be average. The hiding ability was excellent. It dries very quickly.The paint is manufactured with the ability to be applied in cold conditions but this ability can be used all year. Paint is made to dry slow enough to let paint brush strokes flow and level out, while drying fast enough to to become resistant to floating and blowing dust, dirt, debris and curious fingertips. Paying attention to the temperature, humidity, wind and amount of direct sunlight. The temperature will speed the drying time as will direct sunlight as they increase. The dry time will slow as humidity rises and any wind will amplify the effects of humidity.If painting a door or in direct sunlight , you would want to reduce with Floetrol or water, to extend the dry time and allow for brush strokes to disappear.If painting exterior trim, use at full strength and be protected faster from bugs or rain.
reviews.author: Dale

reviews.title: "Storm Coat, Great for Picket Fences"
reviews.text: Bought this product to paint some railings by the front steps outside. It provided great coverage so I decided to tackle a large gate with white pickets across our driveway. Since I'd just sealed the driveway, that gate needed some freshening up! I put two coats on everything and it looks like a million bucks and provides good protection for the wood to boot. If you're looking to paint outdoors, I'd highly recommend this product.
reviews.author: RevPaul

reviews.title: "Mold and Mildew"
reviews.text: I live in a Log home on the river and fight mold and mildew constantly. Do not blame the product, it is a good product for the money. Keep the dirt and dust off and you want have the mold problem. I wash my house about once a month. Mine has looked good for over 10 years now. Still shines like new money. Just a little bit of "Dust: and "Moisture" causes "Mildew"
reviews.author: Ronknee

reviews.title: "Storm Coat is Awesome!"
reviews.text: You can not beat Valspar Storm Coat for the price anywhere. Coverage is great, easy to spread. Have already recommended to friends. Thanks for this great product.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Valspar"
reviews.text: This paint is easy to apply and very easy to clean up afterwards. Bought this last year and needed to do another project and decided to purchase same brand.
reviews.author: kaksgram

reviews.title: "Good coverage"
reviews.text: This product sprays very well and needs no dilution. I discovered this through wasting my first fill adding a slight amount of water as it seemed much thicker than the 1 gal can I had previously purchased. Again, it looks thick but no need to thin it sprays on well with great coverage.Powered washed our burgandy pool fence and covered it with this product in one coat.Good purchase
reviews.author: Outdoorfun

reviews.title: "Excellent paint"
reviews.text: I like this paint, very smooth to apply, good semi-gloss ans easy to wipe clean. I also have used indoors in damp rooms such as baths and utility room. Great product for the money!
reviews.author: Mitch

reviews.title: "This Paint is excellent for the price point"
reviews.text: This is a very durable paint and it holds up great in the hot southern climate and the occasional cold weather that often hits this part of the deep south.
reviews.author: Shelleyfefe

reviews.title: "Pretty good paint"
reviews.text: We used a paint sprayer to apply this paint. Worked pretty good. Will buy this paint in future.
reviews.author: edZik

reviews.text: Using this to paint our deck. The wood is a combination of old, very weathered boards and new boards. This paint is covering both extremely well. You can't tell the difference between old and new.  You could get away with only doing one good thick coat if you wanted to. Very happy with this product.
reviews.author: Allison

reviews.title: "awesome paint so far"
reviews.text: This paint did not have a base coat/primer included, but it did the job wonderfully for my exterior trim touch-up project. It dried within 15 minutes - enough to go over with a second coat - making the job simple enough. The paint itself was super thick - like a half-melted milkshake! I found it to be quite sufficient for the task. The real test will not be final until I see how it performed through winter. We have harsh winters here. But I do feel confident this product will hold up!
reviews.author: punkyof6

reviews.title: "Thick and Creamy"
reviews.text: the Valspar Storm Coat (white) is thick and creamy and has good coverage. We're painting an entire wooden building with it.
reviews.author: galaxyJ

reviews.text: Using this to paint our deck. The wood is a combination of old, very weathered boards and new boards. This paint is covering both extremely well. You can't tell the difference between old and new.  You could get away with only doing one good thick coat if you wanted to. Very happy with this product.
reviews.author: Allison

reviews.title: "Contractor Quality"
reviews.text: I'm a pro painter and this product meets all my paint needs, fills small cracks, good coverage with one coat spraying it.. It's a little cheaper than the other brands.Valspar brand is my brand to paint and the results are awesome, if it works here in AZ where the sun and heat is extreme, for sure will work everywhere else..
reviews.author: 2nydaPainter

reviews.title: "Very good paint"
reviews.text: This is a very good paint, you will still need two coats or more depending on your brush or roller. I recommend using a good brush or roller for the best results. Have not gone through the 4 seasons yet so can't speak to the durability at this time but hopeful it does what it was designed to do.
reviews.author: Strawberry

reviews.title: "Valspar storm coat paint"
reviews.text: Fantastic paint. I am a contractor and this is the only paint I use on trim and doors
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "Pretty good paint"
reviews.text: I used this on an old fence that had moss and stuff still growing on it.  I didn't prime or clean the fence beyond spraying it with a hose.  With one coat, this paint covered and made the fence white.  With two coats in some places, it was able to completely overwhelm the green still growing on the fence.I would purchase it again.
reviews.author: Stephen

reviews.title: "Great paint"
reviews.text: Storm coat covers quickly and very well. I use it in my garage which has old rough timber type boards and it is great. The second coat really makes a great difference.
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "This paint spreads easily and evenly."
reviews.text: This paint was suggested to my by the employee in the paint department. I explained I wanted something not real expensive because I was using it on a wall in my screened in patio. I had it mixed to exactly the color I wanted, and it has become easily my favorite paint. I have done quite a bit of indoor painting, and this is far and above the best I have used. Definitely worth a try.
reviews.author: Mari

reviews.title: "Good Paint"
reviews.text: Best Pain I have used on T-111 outdoor siding and pine trim!
reviews.author: Woodchucker

reviews.title: "Painted love"
reviews.text: I bought this to paint my beehives about the same color as my house to make the hives less noticeable so my neighbors don't freak out.  It is a fairly thick paint, but I still applied 2 coats over 2 coats of primer.  It remained somewhat soft for a few days after each application .  It is very yellow.  I just painted the hives so I have no idea how well the paint will weather.  The bees won't care.
reviews.author: MadUncleDave

reviews.title: "Thick and Creamy"
reviews.text: the Valspar Storm Coat (white) is thick and creamy and has good coverage. We're painting an entire wooden building with it.

reviews.title: "Good quality paint."
reviews.text: I used this on the eaves of my home and roof over hang.   I used 2 coats, but only needed one.  I could not get the Severe Weather, Semi Gloss Latex that I had used in 2008.  This is Lowes Replcement according to paint Department. Dries quickly. Looks great. Brushes and spill comes up easily.
reviews.author: Db

reviews.title: "Great Paint, easy to work with!"
reviews.text: I chose this paint for use on an aquarium stand.  Wanted something that would be water proof. This went on thick, and laid out nicely.  Good coverage with two coats.  As with any paint, prep is 99 % of the work.  I had three coats of primer, and sealed all joints with silicon.
reviews.author: Sammy

reviews.title: "Paint For New Sun Room"
reviews.text: Recently remodeled a screened in porch to a sun room and used this storm coat for the trim, woodwork, and adjacent siding. Blended well with the new window panels and was easy to supply. Looking forward to using a Valspar product for two bathrooms soon to be remodeled.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Mildew resistance is terrible"
reviews.text: This paint has the worst mildew resistance I have ever used, I'm going to have to re-paint my whole house after two years.This kind of problem is unacceptable in this stage of latex development.
reviews.author: Gabe

reviews.title: "Paint Faded within 6 months and rep won't call me"
reviews.text: I pressure washed, primed, and painted 2 coats. Coverage was good and it looked great. But not even 6 months and it is faded. Lowes says rep has to call me, they nothing about warranty. Rep won't call me and I have emailed Valspar also and no response.
reviews.author: BatMan

reviews.title: "Storm coat paint"
reviews.text: I have used this paint on two separate projects, one to paint the exterior of a house boat and for the ceiling in my current home. On both occasions I have found this paint easy to use and of extremely high standard. It goes on easily and is very forgiving in it coverage. The ceiling in my home is vaulted and I didn't want to have to paint it for a couple of years and found this to be the fitting paint. I would highly recommend this paint to any one who wants a lasting and durable paint.
reviews.author: Virg

reviews.title: "valspar"
reviews.text: really great paint! covers well, easy to spread, consistent color, no drippy problems!
reviews.author: terri

reviews.title: "Love this paint!"
reviews.text: This paint covers very well and dries quickly. Durable too. Overall a great paint!
reviews.author: JPaul

reviews.title: "Great Paint!"
reviews.text: So far, I have only 1 coat on and it looks really good. It covers very well!
reviews.author: Cindy

reviews.title: "Excellent coverage!!"
reviews.text: We rebuilt and screened in a front porch for our mom and used Stormcoat for the railings and framing. Went on smoothly in one coat   Loved it!
reviews.author: Memmaes

reviews.title: "Paint"
reviews.text: I bought this paint to cover my CornH boards. It is good quality and did a good job . I would recommend this to everyone. Good price ad well.
reviews.author: Matewan36

reviews.title: "with primer one of the worst coverage paint ever"
reviews.text: primer the entire structure applied paint with roller and paint picked up the previous roll swipe when over lapping. did a very poor job of covering the siding. took 2 coats to cover so ended up being very expensive with primer, 2 gallons of paint and all day to cover 300 square feet.
reviews.author: Dad

reviews.title: "Valspar Storm Coat white semi-gloss"
reviews.text: I bought this paint to match Valspar Severe Weather semi-gloss white that I used previously. I guess the Severe Weather name has been changed to Storm coat. I am disappointed in the sheen as a semi-gloss, as it seems to lean more toward a satin sheen. Sheen-wise it does not match the product I previously used. I am going to return it and see if a different lot number would be more of a semi-gloss sheen.
reviews.author: Gary

reviews.title: "Valspar Stormcoat Semi-Gloss Latex Exterior Paint"
reviews.text: Been using Storm Coat for 3 years now.... GREAT Exterior paint.
reviews.author: Dale

reviews.title: "Needs multiple coats..."
reviews.text: Pretty bad paint.  I've painted three house interiors over the last few years with paint from multiple suppliers, and this one is the worst.  Takes  multiple coats, blotchy finish, even when painting over a new (white) surface.  I don't recommend.
reviews.author: Tyson

reviews.title: "I knew I should have bought Sherwin-Williams paint"
reviews.text: I purchased semi-gloss exterior white paint. I use Kilz paint as a primer and the paint still took three coats and still not really happy with the results. the paint seem really thin and didn't cover well. I used a purdy brush to apply the paint.
reviews.author: Frankie

reviews.title: "Color selection"
reviews.text: I have bought about 7 different gallons of this paint..  It is good paint, I think, but the big problem I have with this paint is you cannot get the color right.  Most people probably don't even notice, but the paint doesn't match the paint chip you have requested and it does not match Valspar website.  It seems that Lowes employees go by a formula for adding tint and put a little splotch of paint on the lid near the label but don't put it on your paint chip(which never matches.  I like the price and quality but wish you could get the color right so that it could be duplicated over and over in gallon cans.  I could bring it back to the store and they would maybe darken it, but you are dam sure not going to get your money back.
reviews.author: MrGreenpump

reviews.title: "nice even"
reviews.text: Nice even coverage even black over white works great on fiberglass, plastic, wood, concrete blocks and concrete
reviews.author: Tanya

reviews.title: "Neutral"
reviews.text: The paint itself is fine; it holds up and is easy to apply. However it is about $20.00 higher than comparable paints at other locations. 20% is enough to make me look elsewhere.
reviews.author: ttttt

reviews.title: "Great Paint"
reviews.text: i see alot of ppl complaining about how the turns out and i know some didn't even bother takeing the proper steps, we buy 50-200 gal a yr, u should always have the paint shaken at store b4 u take it out of store, 2 make sure have the house clean, this means all the dirt and lose paint scraped, powered washed if needed and all rotted wood replaced. recaulk where needed, yes i have gotten bad paint b4 it happens sometimes it shouldnt but it does, and yes i have painted with it in 35f weather it sucks but it will go on, and if u need more than 2 coats then u are either put very thin coats on or ur house is so dry that its sucking it up very seldom do i put on more than 1 coat i put it on thicker than most ppl i hate doing a job twice
reviews.author: Piaredneck

reviews.title: "Great Paint"
reviews.text: I painted a 30-year old house with rough plywood siding, like you see on most sheds.  It had not been painted since new and the wood was very thirsty.  I used semi-gloss StormCoat and was very happy with the results.  Sealed very well and looks great a year later.  I did need 3-4 coats in the most damaged areas.  Each new coat goes on easier and takes less paint.  Anyone having problems probably did not do good surface prep.  Painting a house is like painting a car, good surface cleaning and prep is crucial.  I pressures washed first and then scraped all weak areas.  Then I used a mold killing primer in the bad areas.  Then I rolled/brushed it on.  I do not recommend spraying a house.  You need to work the paint in to get a great seal.
reviews.author: Ed999

reviews.title: "EASY TO WORK WITH,"
reviews.text: THE COLOR MATCHING BY THE LOWES CREW WAS GREAT. ID BOUGHT A SIMILAR PAINT AT 2 OTHER STORES AND ENDED UP WITH A WALL THAT WAS 3 DIFFERENT COLORS. THIS FIXED THAT.
reviews.author: YOMAHMAH2003

reviews.title: "Excellent product!"
reviews.text: I do not understand the reviewer who says his paint did not dry in 17 hours. I used this paint when the temperature was around 70 to 80 degrees and if anything, it dried extremely fast! I was painting fiber cement siding and I would estimate it was drying to touch in about 15 to 30 minutes. This paint is pretty thick and I ended up cutting it down with water. This is excellent paint and either the reviewer giving it bad reviews works for a competitor, did not stir the paint, or was painting over a surface that was oily or in some way unpaintable.
reviews.author: Magnum7

reviews.title: "Best paint for the price"
reviews.text: I bought this paint in March of 16 to paint the exterior of my home and wanted to wait to give an honest review. After almost a year this paint looks just as glossy and great as the day it went on. We have an airless sprayer and used that which automatically puts on two coats at once and it worked flawlessly with the sprayer. The paint is a little thick but, has held up the the elements perfectly.. Even the scorching Texas heat! Would definitely recommend it to anyone and would definitely use it again but, I am hoping this lasts me a long time!
reviews.author: TexasChristi

reviews.title: "Doesn't cover primer even with 3+ coats"
reviews.text: Doesn't cover primer even with 3+ coats.
reviews.author: BobBarker

reviews.title: "Horrible Coverage"
reviews.text: I tinted this paint and bright white and had to put two coats to cover by old white paint.
reviews.author: Menard

reviews.title: "super thin"
reviews.text: I purchased just to paint trim white over white and it took 3 coats to cover. never again.
reviews.author: frankie

reviews.title: "Great Paint"
reviews.text: Paint was easy to use, no drips & very good coverage
reviews.author: Roy77

reviews.title: "Solid paint, great price"
reviews.text: I have purchased this product multiple times.  Lowes color matched it the first time, and did so to perfection.  Goes on thick but I highly recommend a "gray" primer, Kilz or Zinser, both work equally well and the gray insures you don't have to use a second coat as you would have to with a white primer.
reviews.author: Walkerw318

reviews.text: Used this to paint my basement walls and floor. Coverage is excellent, dries to the touch in quickly.
reviews.author: Kerry

reviews.title: "The top paint on the market"
reviews.text: Now is the time to protect your home from the elements. I use only Valspar Storm Coat for my exterior painting. I have been a contractor for over 30 years and I believe that it is the best paint on the market, or should I say on my house. Anyway, my house is three stories up and that is no fun on a ladder, so when I paint I want the best.
reviews.author: Bob-the-builder

reviews.title: "Not White"
reviews.text: This paint was supposed to be an exterior semi-gloss white but it had a blue hue to it and did not cover nor show a good finished product. Took it back. Hoping this next pick works better. Very frustrating to have to repaint!
reviews.author: Rick

reviews.title: "great trim paint"
reviews.text: This was purchased to paint outside trim for the house. Went on easily and seemed to cover more than the area listed but was put on with a brush. It covered previous paint without any issue. There was a lot of moisture in the air and it seemed to dry more slowly than expected.
reviews.author: morningstar

reviews.title: "valspar stormcoat"
reviews.text: the worst paint I have ever used. after three coats on wood, could hardly tell there was any paint on it. call the store but absolutely no help even from the store manger. will never use again. A big waste of money.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "White Paint"
reviews.text: I bought the bright white paint.  I am doing a masonry wall, some of it painted and some not.  The paint went on well but I needed 2 coats to cover it well.  So far, it has adhered to the pre-painted wall and the non-painted wall.  It was easy to clean up with just hot water.
reviews.author: markm

reviews.title: "Much better than Olympic Paint"
reviews.text: I should have paid a few dollars extra and bought this paint to start with. I used 2 coats of Olympic paint and streaks were still present. I used the Valspar to make it look good. Bottom Line....don't buy a cheap substitute. Do it right the first time.
reviews.author: Buzz

reviews.title: "Really great paint."
reviews.text: Really great paint. Good weather resistance. I've used this paint for years on my patio trim and posts.  Holds up well against rain & snow. Now I'm using it indoors for my window jambs & casings. It's working great!
reviews.author: Darrel

reviews.title: "Will not buy again."
reviews.text: Used this on new soffit and fascia of my home. All was primed properly before applying. Less than two years and I have mold growing. Didn't notice till now that it is "not" mold resistant. I live near Dallas TX.
reviews.author: tbonejerry

reviews.title: "Found less than satisfying"
reviews.text: We bought a gallon of Valspar Stormcoat to prime new wood construction on a patio roof that we had installed. When we ran out and needed to get more paint, we didn't want to travel the 20 miles to the nearest Lowe's to get the same product. So we went to a hardware store 10 miles away that carried Valspar paint. We were disappointed to find that while carrying Valspar paint, they didn't have the Stormcoat that we wanted. Still not wanting to travel farther, we opted for Kilz2 Latex Multi-surface Stainblocker. This product gave better coverage than the Valspar Stormcoat. We have always liked Valspar paint and have used for several household projects. However, if we hadn't needed to replenish our supply as we did, we would have never realized that we could have chosen a better product to begin with.
reviews.author: TD

reviews.title: "Great paint !"
reviews.text: I got this paint in the discounted section ( oops paint). It's fantastic ! It covered well with one coat I painted a porch, deck and skirting on a house and it looked great, very happy with product
reviews.author: KS

reviews.title: "Valspar Storm Coat Exterior Latex paint"
reviews.text: My painters recommended this paint and used it on the exterior of my home. The professional painters advised that this paint was very good and would wear well. They use it on a regular basis.
reviews.author: Wanda

reviews.title: "Not as adveritised/promoted"
reviews.text: I purchased this paint knowing that it was not a high priced product, but it is listed as high coverage with approx. 350 SQFT of coverage on smooth surfaces. Unfortunately, when I rolled it onto the smooth side of OSB it still took 3 coats to cover and one gallon only covered 160 SQFT. In the end I would have been better off and cheaper to buy a better quality paint (Sherwin Williams, Behr).
reviews.author: DL12

reviews.title: "Excellent exterior paint"
reviews.text: It went on very smoothly & after 2nd coat the color was very rich looking. Painted 3 garage doors and received many Wows from neighbors and friends!
reviews.author: tbirdfox

reviews.title: "Excellent"
reviews.text: This is the perfect paint to use in a high moisture area like the bathroom. I used this to give my bathroom a fresh look on a budget.
reviews.author: Shawn

reviews.text: So so , it's been on shed for a week now and it still seams tacky to the touch. Hopefully it will hold up to test of time.
reviews.author: Larry

reviews.title: "Great Paint for the price"
reviews.text: Great paint goes on the surface very good and dries with a professional look, Don't forget to use a good quality brush.
reviews.author: JP

reviews.title: "Great paint"
reviews.text: I sprayed it and brushed. Great coverage being sprayed. Brushing need 2 coats. I does dry quickly
reviews.author: E

reviews.title: "unhappy"
reviews.text: painted a wood shed that had a prime coat  on it  cover in one coat, BUT only cover 165 SQ feet
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Advantages of Fast Drying Paints"
reviews.text: This paint was made with the ability to dry in cold weather. Low temperatures and high humidity slow the dry time, which allows for trash to be blown into the wet paint or runs and sags can develop. If the paint dries too fast you will end up with bush and roller marks and a difficult clean up of tools. Take control of your dry time by reducing the paint with Floetrol additive or water. You can make the paint fast dry or slow dry with no effect on color or quality.
reviews.author: Dale

reviews.title: "Excellent coverage"
reviews.text: Use a thick mat roller for excellent one coat coverage.
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Great Price and Low Temperture Tolerance"
reviews.text: I am a paint contractor and have used this product for several years including on my personal house. It goes on smoothly, cures hard and lasts a long time. The price is reasonable...$10 to $25 (or more) LESS a gallon than the high level paints. It is my go-to paint for when winter sets in because I can apply it down to 35 degrees. Info: You don't want it to drop below that temperature for 24 hours after application. Great medium grade paint. Why spend more?
reviews.author: Chappy

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Tom

reviews.title: "Garage Cabinet Project"
reviews.text: Choose this paint to use on new wood cabinets I built for an unheated garage.  Went on smooth and did not run but was surprised it did not cover in one coat.  Previously had painted the cabinet carcass, panel doors and shelves with a white primer.  Also decided to use an exterior paint to handle temperature swings in the unheated garage.  Used the semi-gloss paint so the cabinets could be easily dusted, vacuumed or wiped down with a wet cloth.
reviews.author: Gus

reviews.title: "Paint is supposed to dry right?"
reviews.text: The can says that the "tack free" time is 1-2 hours depending on the temperature.After 17 hours the paint was still liquid. Since it was a little humid and a little cool outside I then put a tent over the entire thing and put a propane heater in there. Several hours later the paint was still liquid.The only nice thing about this paint is when you decide to give up and use a different paint you can just wash it off with a garden hose.
reviews.author: rsf0000001

reviews.title: "Not pure white"
reviews.text: I bought this semi gloss white to finish painting inside my garage. I had already painted part of the ceiling and bought this to finish my garage. It turned out not to be white as it should have been, it was a very light grey.I had to go over the other white to make everything match. On top of the container which was white you could see where I poured out the paint it was not white like the container. Not fully satisfied with the color.
reviews.author: Leo

reviews.title: "Cheap paint"
reviews.text: Four days of drying 79-80 degrees, paint on door peels off on jamb. Second door used painters tape to edge, paint came off in clumps on tape. Worst paint I have ever used. Doors have been left open to dry 15+ hours each day, door jamb taped to prevent sticking at night. One section of tape came loose 4th night, paint peeled right off door.
reviews.author: Dawn

reviews.title: "Good Coverage for Concrete Block!"
reviews.text: Storm Coat exterior paint provided good coverage for an exterior storage room I needed to paint. The walls were concrete block, and one coat covered them. The shelves were older wood, and had never been painted. It took 2 coats to cover most of the wood, and in some cases, 3 coats, especially where there were knots in the wood. Maybe I should have used some other paint for the wood, but it did a great job for the block.
reviews.author: SeniorWoman

reviews.title: "NOT THE BEST PAINT"
reviews.text: After putting on a top quality oil base coat, the paint dried streaky and did not cover at all. There was no gloss at all, very dull, and did not cover. The coverage is thin at best. and would take at least 4 coats to cover the material.Lowes said to return the paint and they will give me the best paint free for any problems. That's why I shop Lowes!!!
reviews.author: farout

reviews.title: "waste of money and time"
reviews.text: I purchased samples of two different colors. I felt they would look nice so I purchased two gallons of those colors in the Storm Coat Semi-Gloss. The exterior paint did not dry to the color of the sample nor the color of the paint "swatches". I wasted money and time. I was very dissatisfied with the Valspar paint. I much prefer the Behr exterior paint you handled in the past.
reviews.author: Tikki

reviews.title: "Always Lowes, Always Valspar"
reviews.text: My Wife and I have been using Valspar for over 10 years, and every time we think we might try another brand just once for just a slight color change or what not, we always are disappointed, and we end up kicking our selves in the rear end, and wonder why we didn't listen to ourselves when we said remember last time.  We have been OTHER BRAND free for the last 5 years, this house is a Valspar home for life.
reviews.author: Green

reviews.title: "ugh !"
reviews.text: used this paint on a exterior metal door with poor results...so thin...had to keep stirring paint due to color separation. used 4 coats and I was not happy with the results. I may have not read the whole label correctly may have said ...use recommended for vinyl exterior walls and I was thinking STORM doors. but had to use it because I had it colored and could not return it
reviews.author: dishwasheruserforover35years

reviews.title: "GARBAGE"
reviews.text: Storm coat is not worth the money. I used it on my house and even though the first coat went on fine the second coat would not adhere to the first. No matter what we did it ran off the house as fast as you could put it on either by spray or by brush. The Valspar rep advised us that he didn't know what could be wrong with it and never offered a solution only to use a smaller spray tip. DON"T BUY THIS JUNK.
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY"
reviews.text: We painted our house less than a year ago. It looked great for about 6 months then our neighbors told us to look at the side of the house. When we did we were shocked so we started looking around the house at other areas more closely. The paint looks awful. We are going to have to repaint the whole house in less than a year! This is totally unacceptable. We will not recommend this paint to anyone!
reviews.author: DLANCASTER

reviews.title: "Beautiful coverage."
reviews.text: I am in the process of using this paint for the trim of my house. It dries wonderfully and the coverage is more than pleasing, even on the gutters and downspouts. I am using also, to paint the ceiling of my exposed porch and it covered a much darker color in almost one coat.I was initially thinking I was going to need 3 for adequate coverage, but it looks like two will easily take care of it.
reviews.author: squirrelgirl

reviews.title: "Valspar is good paint"
reviews.text: I have used Valspar paint for years and love the coverage and quality.I don't like to paint so I give it a 4 on ease of use.
reviews.author: Melvin

reviews.title: "Perfect for my needs"
reviews.text: I asked the salesman at the Lowes counter if he had a cheap paint for my trailer and he recommended this.  I have a 70 year old house trailer in Florida for snowbird occupancy, neat old collector's item.  I did it in aqua pastel with crockery orange trim.  Painted with one double coat to cover and it has held up well for three years now.  Any stains or green stuff washes off easily.
reviews.author: Grubby

reviews.title: "good value"
reviews.text: Bought this paint to use on un- primed engineered siding. Went on easy , is thick , so coverage is good. I could have probably got away with 1 coat but gave it 2. Dry's quickly and looks great and I feel a bargain as it is relatively inexpensive as compared to other exterior paints. Pans and brushes clean easily with soap and water. Can't find anything negative to sat about it.
reviews.author: Robbie

reviews.title: "Great product. Definitely a great paint and price"
reviews.text: I always shop at Lowe's for my home needs. Remodeling projects. Upgrades. Maintenance care. Never been dissatisfied.
reviews.author: Parker

reviews.title: "Makes the job easy"
reviews.text: I bought this paint to paint the walls and ceilings in my attached garage. You know how garages get all kinds of dings and dirt and this paint covers very well. It goes on easy with the roller and brush. I am doing woodwork, doors and frames and ceilings. Thank you to the gentleman in the paint dept. that suggested this when I described what I wanted.
reviews.author: Fran

reviews.title: "mwalkerbhappy"
reviews.text: used valspar storm coat exterior flat to paint my house.  at first it looked wonderful but the next day when it was dry it had white streaks.  when my husband sprayed it with the water hose thinking that would take care of it we also ended up with water marks that seem to be permanent.  i would not recommend this paint for outside house painting.

reviews.title: "Great coverage, easy cleanup"
reviews.text: We used this to paint our interior garage walls with rollers. It is thick and covers up the typical drywall scars and blunders that garage walls accumulate. Goes on easy, cleans up easy, leaves a semi-gloss finish not too shiny, yet easy to wipe off dirt, splashes, spills, etc. First rate product!
reviews.author: ARM3

reviews.title: "Covers well"
reviews.text: this paint is thick and covers well just like a paint should. It is not a paint and primer combination so it should not be used over bare wood but, as in my case, it is good for painting over already painted surfaces. It is too soon to report on how well it's performance but my hopes are high.
reviews.author: JM

reviews.text: I am not happy that the Paint comes in .90 gallon. Why not 1 gallon like everyone else? I did not realize the paint was less then 1 gallon when I purchased. I am really tried of company's down sizing their products
reviews.author: dcrichmond

reviews.title: "So Far So Good!"
reviews.text: Purchased this paint last week for my porch railings, picked this one because of the price. Very thick paint, goes on smooth and has good coverage, dries pretty quick and helps hide imperfections in the wood. Looks like its going to be very good, going to purchase more for my back porch.
reviews.author: Neilster21

reviews.title: "Horrible Paint"
reviews.text: I bought this to paint the exterior of my home and it does not cover! We had to do over three coats and it still did not cover. The house was white and we were painting it white so color was not an issue. The job looks terrible. Save yourself the hassle and buy a better quality paint!!!
reviews.author: Frustrated123

reviews.title: "Exceeded expectation"
reviews.text: We bought the paint to finish the newly installed wood panneling on our roof. We used a electric sprayer, thinking it would need several coats we bought the 5 gallon drum. Turns out the quality was so good that we only used about 1 gallon for the job! Highly recommend this product.
reviews.author: Romeze

reviews.title: "Wonderful paint"
reviews.text: Read all the reviews before purchase and went with the majority.  Glad we did. Great paint, painted aluminum siding that's 40 yrs old and coverage was great, dried within 30 minutes and very easy to paint without drips. Only used 1 coat to cover.  We'd use again in northern IN
reviews.author: Classicoldies

reviews.title: "GREAT paint!!!!"
reviews.text: We used this on the campground tabernacle after thorough powerwashing and letting it dry well. Stormcoat is so creamy you will think you can eat it with a spoon. It goes on well, covers well, and has held up well. We are still using it on other buildings around the grounds.
reviews.author: galaxyJ

reviews.title: "Outdoor paint for deck rail"
reviews.text: Color was supposed to be Beachwood. First quart looked great. Went to get a gallon and color was different.  Had paint mixer check and agreed it was different. Didn't purchase.  I had the original can with mix label so she mixed using the original tints.  Looks close.
reviews.author: DaveEastOhio

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: mojo

reviews.title: "Great Paint for the money!"
reviews.text: We used Storm Coat to paint our house two years ago and, it still looks great. Two applications used, Airless Sprayer and brush. Also, used two different colors(one being white for trim) and, both still look great! I would recommend this paint for sure!
reviews.author: TexasBelle

reviews.title: "Deck painting"
reviews.text: It's always a pain to have to paint the deck with all the railings and pickets however this product was exceptional it went on smoothly with very little touch up in mixed very easily. I was very satisfied with the end result and the product in general.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Great paint,"
reviews.text: Since I just bought this paint I don't know about the quality or how long it will last,. It is easy to apply and goes a long way. I gave it a good ranking because of the ease of choosing a color since I used it on plank fence. Fence looks great.
reviews.author: Lenkenne

reviews.title: "Good paint for the price."
reviews.text: I chose this paint because I wanted a low cost paint to make Corn hole boards for outdoors. The paint goes on smooth. It took about 3 coats to really cover the plywood. Not sure how long it will last compared to higher quality outdoor paints.
reviews.author: CAN2

reviews.title: "Great paint!"
reviews.text: This paint covers very well, and considering I used it on a 115 y/o house, it covered better than expected. I would recommend this paint to anyone. The fact that I received a rebate on top of it puts this purchase in the outstanding category.
reviews.author: Ed

reviews.title: "Covered Great"
reviews.text: After consult with our Lowe's paint "guru", we primed cinder blocks in our always dry basement and then used this product as the final coat. It worked and covered great. Wouldn't have thought to use this type of paint inside. Thanks Vern.
reviews.author: Smitty

reviews.title: "It spread and covered great."
reviews.text: The paint went on just fine and covered the clapboards that had lost their paint. With paint one does not know how good it performs until it has been exposed to the weather for a period of time. Based on initial application, it is great.
reviews.author: Brushcreek

reviews.title: "Excellent product"
reviews.text: This is a very good paint. It is slightly thick which makes it cover surfaces very well. It reminds me of WeatherBeater paint that Sears used to sell. That was the only paint I would ever use outside. This paint is very similar to it.
reviews.author: hotshot

reviews.title: "Awesome coverage. Easy to apply, cleanup fast!"
reviews.text: Lowe's employee mixed this storm coat exterior paint and matched the color I picked out. The color went on so well I didn't need a second coat. I will be back next year to buy more for my deck railings.
reviews.author: Jay

reviews.title: "not easy to use"
reviews.text: I have been using the Sherwin Williams ovation. It is very forgiving and easy to use. I Bought this as a cheaper alternative to go over the Sherwin-Williams I had already put on the trim. It was very difficult to use and spread.
reviews.author: Bigdog

reviews.title: "covered the best I have ever seen"
reviews.text: little disappointed when i ran out of paint and only need approx a pint would have bought a quart but they only sell it in a gallon so that was 22 dollars for a pint of paint that's makes it darn EXPENSIVEVERY VERY GOOD PAINT
reviews.author: STONEMAN

reviews.title: "good Ext. paint"
reviews.text: this is a good quality paint that seems to work as good as other bands in the same price range, we had no problems with one coat coverage over primer, dries in a short time and recoated well, guess now is the test of time.....
reviews.author: avl10043

reviews.title: "Valspar Stormcoat"
reviews.text: I have used this paint on a balcony a couple of years ago.  It's exposed to the sun most of the time and have no complaints with the way it bias held up. I have just painted the house my daughter is living in. Looks very nice.
reviews.author: William

reviews.title: "Used it for inside my garage"
reviews.text: Needed a paint that wasn't expensive but not poor quality. Choose a gray color and this paint for the inside of my south florida garage. Went on easy, but I had to apply 2 coats because of the deep gray color. So far so good.
reviews.author: Jbmia

reviews.title: "A double for me please"
reviews.text: I love the paint so far holding up great the only drawback was it took two coats to fully cover the areas and being exterior didn't really want to spend extra time outside in the heat. Otherwise I would recommend this product
reviews.author: EmJay

reviews.title: "Its the first time I bought STORM COAT"
reviews.text: This was one of the paints I have used. It went on very smooth and filled in some minor nail holes. Dry quickly. I used this on my basement stairs... being the basement was on the damp side, I let dry overnight. Outstanding.
reviews.author: Shorty

reviews.title: "Excellent coverage!"
reviews.text: I used this on bare wood, and it covered beautifully. I put a second coat on, mostly to get the paint into creases that I had missed on the first pass. Outstanding coverage.My ugly little duck house is much prettier now.
reviews.author: Kaessa

reviews.title: "Goes on great! Great for a first time painter."
reviews.text: Got a lot of help in the paint department. Am coming back for new lighting for the bathroom.
reviews.author: Candy

reviews.title: "Not impressed at all!!!"
reviews.text: It was supposed to be tinted red...it was more like dark pink.  Not good for a hunting camp shed
reviews.author: Judy

reviews.title: "Great results!"
reviews.text: I painted three old semi truck doors with it. Worked and covered great with a brush. The doors looked terrible and were a mix of wood, old paint and rust stains. It covered in one coat but two coats look like new!
reviews.author: Jerryut

reviews.title: "Great quality at a great price"
reviews.text: As a professional residential painter I discovered this product last year and have tried to turn my customers on to it ever since. I find the quality is comparable to $70 per gallon paint at the specialty store.
reviews.author: Andy

reviews.title: "great paint"
reviews.text: I use this paint on metal roofs and walls.  This is a very good paint. Great coverage.I just also purchase two 5 gal containers of this paint.  I have a couple of outside building and roof on a house to paint.
reviews.author: dryascork

reviews.title: "Great Paint!"
reviews.text: I painted the block underpinning on my older mobile home. It has been 2 years now and it still looks great. I have purchsed this for several other projects also. Would recommend this paint for any exterior job.
reviews.author: Sharon 7

reviews.title: "Covers well and easy clean up"
reviews.text: Paint covers well, even bare wood. Cleans up with water and appears tough and durable. Paint can be applied even in low temps. I painted with it with temps in the 40s and it dried well/rather quickly.
reviews.author: carl

reviews.title: "appropiate fit for inclement weather.."
reviews.text: Applies easily, requiring one coat only;  color matches color chart right on target;  a bit pricier than some other products, but well worth the cost. I am a retired miner who is a do-it-yourselfer..
reviews.author: Verncope

reviews.title: "Storm coat paint"
reviews.text: Slightly thinner than what I normally buy. Good value. Wondering how long it will last. Would have given a 4 if it was a little thicker. Good for rentals you have to repaint often. Yes I do recommend
reviews.author: Lynn

reviews.title: "love lowes"
reviews.text: Lowes paint department is wonderful at matching my paint, it just so happened that the evening I had gone one machine was down and the girl had no help but the quality of the paint was worth the wait
reviews.author: shirl805

reviews.title: "First time user of this product"
reviews.text: Just bought me first gallon to paint porch rails, spindles and posts. Paint went on nicely after priming. Looks good. Can't give a complete endorsement until I see how it holds up to weather.
reviews.author: KenKre

reviews.title: "exterior paint"
reviews.text: Appears to be a quality paint.  Goes on great and leaves few brush marks. Dries fast,no runs. Price ok.  Will have to see how it weathers over the next couple years. Enough said, Thanks
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Great paint"
reviews.text: Very easy paint to apply. Covered mostly in one coat. Filled in the wood cracks nicely. Extremely happy with this paint. I already have a few friends going to get the same paint brand.
reviews.author: Johnny

reviews.title: "Valspar has always given me a great finish."
reviews.text: Lowes personnel give a feeling of pride and they care for their customers. They treat everyone like a family member that they like to best describe how they make the customer feel.
reviews.author: Barney

reviews.title: "Excellent Exterior Paint"
reviews.text: I have used this paint for several years on exterior trim, alcoves, and deck posts.  It is durable, retains its color without fading or chalking, and the view is appealing.
reviews.author: Spiretop

reviews.title: "As good as any name brand ext. trim paint"
reviews.text: The paint seems to be as good as any other name brand paint, we will update this review after a few years as to how well it holds up to the weather here in North Carolina.
reviews.author: dalesoil1

reviews.title: "Great value"
reviews.text: This paint is thick and covers well .painted 100 feet of railings and 16 6x6 post on the porch.bought three gallons but only used 1 and 1/2 gallons .i would recomend it .
reviews.author: Gone77

reviews.title: "doesn't last"
reviews.text: even after priming wood paint bubbles up and comes off had it tented came out light when first applied but did darken some but not to the color it was supposed to be.
reviews.author: sed63

reviews.title: "JUST THE RIGHT MIX AFTER STORE CLERK ANALYSIS"
reviews.text: Couldn't be more happy with the little splotch of paint I BROUGHT AND they matched that blended right with my outside WALL MAKING the new undetectable. Thanks Lowe's
reviews.author: Robert

reviews.title: "Excellent"
reviews.text: I've purchased this product before and its always worked perfect for me! Great coverage and holds up extremely well. Ill continue to use this all the time.
reviews.author: KK78

reviews.title: "great exterior trim paint"
reviews.text: Purchased this trim in a white color just to do touch ups on my homes trim and decks. Love how is goes on , spreads, and cleans up. Coverage is fantastic.
reviews.author: LeahRenae

reviews.title: "great paint"
reviews.text: This paint was the best paint I've used so far. It's thicker than most so it covers well and goes on easy. Thanks valspar for making such a good product.
reviews.author: tina8771

reviews.title: "Great product"
reviews.text: Excellent customer service when we had the wrong color that did not match what we had previously purchased. They took care of the problem immediately.
reviews.author: Baybay

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: Do not buy! Goes on like water, I have had to put 3 coats on just to cover existing beige paint, spent a little more and save time in the long run...
reviews.author: Draw

reviews.title: "Valspar storm coat exterior paint"
reviews.text: Paint went on well , looked thick and to be of good quality. We will definitely be buying more in the near future to finish our outdoor projects.
reviews.author: Monica

reviews.title: "Valspar Storm"
reviews.text: It sprayed really nice. Although subjective, I use a finger nail test: four days later and the paint is still on my nails! Valspar is nice stuff.
reviews.author: Patty

reviews.title: "Nice!  Good coverage and easy clean up."
reviews.text: I bought this to refinish my shutters.  It is a thick paint, but cleans up easily with water.  I highly recommend this for your outdoor projects.
reviews.author: mtateman3

I can not even recommend the rescue paints for decks that receive traffic at this time though... we used the new paints for decks in two areas 1. a deck that was around a pool and it peeled away because it was not pressure washed which was the recommendation on the can. Where we pressure washed held up better. and also on our deck at home, high dog traffic -- not good results!

answers.author: CommunityAnswer

Additional information can be found at www.cabotstain.com or by calling our Experts at 877-825-7727 seven days a week from 8a-8p EST.

questions.question: "can ext latex paint #147475 val. be used for base boards & door frames inside"

answers.author: BethieJ
answers.text: Exterior paint has properties in it for the sunlight /ultra brightness of outside. When you are painting with close work like that -- extra brushing tends to get on the areas that you did not want painted. Happy painting !!!

Rain, snow, freezing temps, summer temps, etc. I usually use exterior paint on interior projects so I know it can handle the any unknown added stress.

questions.question: "For interior garage walls, is the exterior paint better?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: George
answers.text: You are right in that the exterior exposure is what is found in the garage. Use Kilz primer, then exterior semigloss. I suppose by now you have already painted the garage.

answers.author: Bob-the-builder
answers.text: What ever you do will work. Exterior paint is a softer product than the interior paint. Exterior paint does not have the hardeners in it that interior paint has, because of the simple fact that people can easily touch the interior paint. They need something in the paint to resist the fingerprints. It's up to you, but I would put interior in the garage area, maybe in a satin rather a flat. You will not have to paint as often. The primer is always a good idea!

answers.author: MathGuy
answers.text: If the garage is unheated I would use exterior. If it is heated (more stable temperature environment) use interior.

answers.author: TeamValspar
answers.text: Thank you for your interest in Valspar. Great question. I think many of us view a garage as more of an exterior space. However, given a garage's interior is exposed to very little, if any, actual weather, we treat it as an interior, and as such, recommend the use of an interior paint. If you have additional questions please contact our Consumer Relations Team directly at 1-877-825-7727 at your earliest convenience as they are standing by to assist you.

questions.question: "Would I be able to use this on my front door?"
questions.author: Kk

answers.author: TeamValspar
answers.text: Thank you for your question. This product can be used on the exterior of your front door.

answers.author: Kk
answers.text: It's a steel door that faces south with no storm door. We live in Missouri. Not sure I want the shine from a gloss enamel. The door gets the evening sun.

answers.author: Andy
answers.text: In short, Yes this paint can be used on a door, but many people prefer a gloss enamal for cleanability. Why would it being a "front" door be an issue? More importantly, is the door wood, metal, fiberglass? Different preps may be required depending on the door. What type of paint is on the door now? Is it a new door? Is it pre-primed? Is the door protected from the sun? Is it directly exposed to the sun? Where do you live? If you live in the south, and the door faces West (the worst exposure; not south like many believe), and it is not completely shaded, and has a storm door over the door, then the sun will bake the door, and paint will fade and deteriorate more quickly.

answers.author: Bob-the-builder
answers.text: It is my understanding as a contractor, that all paint manufactured in the southeast has a mildew resistant formula already in it. Paint manufactures, even Valspar, has to pass inspections and tests before they can sell the paint. Valspar sold paint in the northern states for years before they expanded to the southern states because of the expense of the mildew resistant formula. When their product was approved for Lowe's home improvement, the increased sales made it worth while. All paint bought in the south is mildew resistant. The chemical has a short life span, therefore you will be forced to pressure wash at some point, depending on your weather conditions. Shady areas where the sun cannot reach will mildew faster. After a rain, the wood on your house has to have air and sun, if trees are too close then mildew will begin to grow.

answers.author: Hobbyfarmer
answers.text: It resist mildew the first year, but then, as will all paints I know, will allow mildew to grow on it.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, this resists mildew as well as blistering and chalking.
